intro: Carex baviensis, commonly known as the Baviensian sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to parts of Europe and is typically found in wetland or moist environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and filter water. Carex baviensis is an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting a variety of wildlife.
